decks.notes: This deck focuses on the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful 20/20 flying indestructible token. The deck includes cards like Mox Diamond, Crop Rotation, and Green Sun's Zenith to accelerate and search for the combo pieces. It also includes cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Elvish Reclaimer to tutor for important utility lands. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending to deal with opposing threats. The main goal is to assemble the Dark Depths combo while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to generate an aggressive tempo advantage by utilizing disruptive cards like Grief, Daze, and Force of Will to control the game state. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats such as Brazen Borrower, Murktide Regent, and Orcish Bowmasters to pressure the opponent's life total. Additionally, the deck utilizes reanimation spells like Reanimate and Sheoldred's Edict to efficiently bring back powerful creatures. The mana base is tailored to support the deck's color requirements while also providing access to utility lands like Mystic Sanctuary and Wasteland.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells and removal spells, while also utilizing card advantage and strategic land placement. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and prevent them from executing their strategies effectively. The deck includes various means of card selection and manipulation, such as Ponder and Brainstorm, to ensure consistency and find the necessary answers. Additionally, it incorporates powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to apply pressure and close out the game.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing the combo between Painter's Servant and Grindstone. By controlling the color of all cards in play with Painter's Servant, the deck aims to mill the opponent's entire library by continuously activating Grindstone's ability. This combo is supported by cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder, which assist in getting the necessary pieces onto the battlefield. The deck also includes a variety of disruption and removal spells to protect the combo and handle opposing threats. The mana base consists of fast lands and powerful mana accelerators to ensure a quick and smooth setup.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of powerful removal spells, counter spells, and card draw. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus while protecting itself with counter spells like Force of Will. The deck also utilizes card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to maintain a steady flow of resources. Additionally, it includes some unique cards such as Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Leyline Binding to provide additional value and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering and removing threats while gradually generating card advantage. The deck achieves this through a combination of powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending, countermagic with cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation, and card selection and manipulation with Brainstorm, Ponder, and LÃ³rien Revealed. Additionally, the deck aims to generate extra mana and ramp with Leyline Binding and Up the Beanstalk, and can potentially win through the powerful creatures Murktide Regent and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck's manabase allows for flexibility in casting spells of various colors.

This deck focuses on controlling the game and generating value through its card interactions and efficient creatures. It utilizes a combination of creature tutors (Green Sun's Zenith and Fiend Artisan) and powerful creature threats (Craterhoof Behemoth, Elvish Reclaimer) to win the game. It also has disruption elements with cards like Collector Ouphe and Endurance. Additionally, the deck employs mana acceleration (Gaea's Cradle, Noble Hierarch) to ramp into its larger creatures and spells. It aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent through its strong creature base and versatile spell choices.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through various means such as counter spells, removal, and card draw. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining board presence and card advantage. It utilizes a combination of proactive and reactive plays to dictate the flow of the game. The deck also has a small land package to support its strategy and ensure consistent access to all necessary colors of mana. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and out-value the opponent in order to secure victory.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to create a fast and disruptive game plan. The deck aims to establish early board presence and maintain control over the game by using cards like Legion Warboss, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Fury. It also utilizes cards such as Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Blood Moon to disrupt opponents' strategies and slow down their game plan. The deck takes advantage of its mana acceleration through Simian Spirit Guide, Chrome Mox, and Ancient Tomb to cast powerful threats and spells ahead of curve.

The key concept of this deck is to establish early board presence and apply pressure with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Orcish Bowmasters. It aims to disrupt opponents with counter spells like Daze and Force of Will, while also providing card advantage through spells like Brainstorm and Mishra's Bauble. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to control the board and clear the way for its creatures to attack. The lands in the deck, including Wasteland, provide utility and help optimize the deck's mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly get out a powerful creature equipped with multiple equipment cards, specifically Colossus Hammer and other boosting artifacts. The deck utilizes cards like Puresteel Paladin, Stoneforge Mystic, and Sigarda's Aid to search for and cheat out equipment cards. It also uses Retrofitter Foundry to create additional artifact tokens and Mox Opal for mana acceleration. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a massive, highly equipped creature, capable of dealing significant damage.

The key concept of this deck revolves around utilizing the Mystic Forge combo to generate a powerful advantage. By combining cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, Mox Opal, Lotus Petal, Voltaic Key, and Manifold Key, the deck aims to create a consistent stream of artifacts to fuel its engine. Defense Grid is included to protect the combo from disruption, while the Monoliths and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional mana acceleration and utility. The inclusion of Urza's Saga, Ancient Tomb, and City of Traitors further enhance the deck's ability to generate mana quickly.

This deck focuses on an aggro strategy using blue artifacts. The key concept is to quickly generate mana and card advantage through cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with Chalice of the Void and Force of Will. Urza's Saga allows for the creation of powerful artifacts while Ancient Tomb provides additional mana acceleration. The inclusion of Kappa Cannoneer and Patchwork Automaton adds to the aggressive nature of the deck, while the presence of removal options like Shadowspear and Thought Monitor adds versatility.

This deck revolves around utilizing aggressive creatures like Questing Druid, Orcish Bowmasters, and Dragon's Rage Channeler to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also features control elements such as Murktide Regent, Brazen Borrower, and counterspells like Daze and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck has card filtering and card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble, Brainstorm, and Ponder. The land base consists of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early on while maintaining control of the game.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck focuses on an aggressive playstyle with the goal of overwhelming the opponent quickly. The deck utilizes Cascade mechanics to gain card advantage and put pressure on the opponent. It includes various creatures such as Shardless Agent, Murktide Regent, and Minsc & Boo, Timeless Heroes to maintain board presence and deal damage. The deck also incorporates disruptive elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation to defend against opposing threats. The mana base includes a mix of fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary mana colors.

The key concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo using Helm of Obedience and Leyline of the Void to exile an opponent's entire library. This is supported by cards like Reanimate and Troll of Khazad-dÃ»m to bring back key pieces from the graveyard, and Dark Ritual and Chrome Mox to generate mana quickly. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Opposition Agent and Grief to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to execute its combo as quickly as possible while maintaining control over the game with its disruptive elements.

This deck focuses on using the combo strategy of reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard. It includes cards like Grief, Griselbrand, Archon of Cruelty, and Sire of Insanity as key creatures to bring back. The deck also includes mana acceleration cards like Lotus Petal and Chrome Mox, along with various discard spells such as Thoughtseize and Collective Brutality to fuel the reanimation process. It relies heavily on cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Exhume to bring back creatures quickly and efficiently. The deck is built around a black mana base with Swamp, Marsh Flats, and Verdant Catacombs.
